content.description: <math alttext="The figure shows a 2 row table with 4 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1: x is 0; f of x is 2. Column 2: x is 2, f of x is 3. Column 3: x is 3; f of x is 6. Column 4: x is 5; f of x is 12." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtable columnlines="solid" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>12</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>
content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> is continuous on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 5, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> and differentiable on the open interval <math alttext="open parenthesis, 0 comma 5, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>. Selected values of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> are given in the table shown. The value <math alttext="c equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math> satisfies the conclusion of the Mean Value Theorem for <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma 5, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>. What is the slope of the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> at <math alttext="x equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
